title: The code cannot run in version 1.55, but it can run in version 1.51

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Environment required:
> The code repo is https://github.com/dunmengjun/rCore-user.git

> Required qemu 5.0.0 (if setup from the source just need configure the riscv64 items, such as  ./configure --target-list=riscv64-softmmu,riscv64-linux-user)

>  Required rustup, after clone the code, run rustup show, it will setup the dependency automaticly.

When everything above is ok，you can run cargo build to build the elf file，and  use
```sh
qemu-riscv64 target/riscv64gc-unknown-none-elf/debug/02power
```
to run the elf program in qemu.

Currently the version of rust toolchain is the nightly newest (1.55), so you will get an error that
```
Segmentation fault
```

But if you change the toolchain to nightly-2021-01-30 (1.51), Just make this change, don’t change other things. the command will be running correctly

So the question is why it came out like this? Why I only changed the version of rust, but the results of running the same program are different?

And if we use the newest version of toolchain (1.55) and change the opt-level to 1 or 2 or 3 in .cargo/config, it will work.
```
[profile.dev]
opt-level = 1 # 1 or 2 or 3
```
but in nightly-2021-01-30 (1.51) it always work, don't need change anything.

Why is this so? Beg the big guys for help 😂
